word: We wish to build a sanitarium [in Australia] where maladies may be cured by nature's own provisions, and where the people may be taught how to treat themselves when sick; where they will learn to eat temperately of wholesome food, and be educated to refuse all narcotics-- tea, coffee, fermented wines, and stimulants of all kinds-- and to discard the flesh of dead animals.--Temperance, pp. 88, 89 (General Manuscript, 1896).
